item.description:
Want to hone your organic gardening skills? Join farmer Erin Stack of New Harmony Farm and learn the basics of organic and biological gardening through lecture, discussion and a tour of her certified organic farm as it is prepared for the beginning of the growing season.

Topics include:

Preparing your garden plan

Creating vibrant soil life and why this is essential for healthy plants

Soil fertility inputs

Preparing Inoculants from local plants

Preparing Beds for Planting

Plant spacing and growing requirements for different vegetables

Companion planting

Irrigation options for the small garden

Weed and pest prevention

Good record keeping

Wear warm cloths and shoes that can get muddy.

The cost for this workshop is preregistered (24 hours before the workshop:) $20 and Â drop in: $22.

Rain date is Sunday, April 7. In case of impending bad weather, check www.newharmonyfarm.com homepage for workshop scheduling updates. For more information and to preregister write Erin at erin@newharmonyfarm.com or call 978-807-6315.
item.name: Learn the Basics of Organic and Biological Gardening
